channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Opinion: Bob Newhart showed us the extraordinary in the ordinary
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon remembers understated comedian and actor Bob Newhart, who died this week at the age of 94.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Scott Simon remembers understated comedian and actor Bob Newhart, who died this week at the age of 94.

(Image credit: Jerome T. Nakagawa)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Drone attack hits Tel Aviv; ICJ rules West Bank Israeli settlements are unlawful
item.description: A drone attack came into Israel from over the Mediterranean Sea and struck near the Tel Aviv beachfront. Separately, the U.N's highest court said Jewish settlements in the West Bank are unlawful.
item.content:encoded: A drone attack came into Israel from over the Mediterranean Sea and struck near the Tel Aviv beachfront. Separately, the U.N's highest court said Jewish settlements in the West Bank are unlawful.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Saturday Sports: WNBA All-Star game, Kansas City Chiefs aim to get third-time lucky
item.description: The WNBA All-Star game takes place Saturday. Also, football's Kansas City Chiefs are attempting a three-peat.
item.content:encoded: The WNBA All-Star game takes place Saturday. Also, football's Kansas City Chiefs are attempting a three-peat.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Week in politics: Trump addresses the RNC, more Democrats call for Biden to step down
item.description: Donald Trump capped the Republican National Convention this week, while Joe Biden faced calls to exit the presidential race.
item.content:encoded: Donald Trump capped the Republican National Convention this week, while Joe Biden faced calls to exit the presidential race.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Homeless people are the most vulnerable to extreme heat. A Las Vegas group is helping
item.description: In Las Vegas, the city's homeless residents are among the most vulnerable to illness and death from the scorching weather.
item.content:encoded: In Las Vegas, the city's homeless residents are among the most vulnerable to illness and death from the scorching weather.
item.dc:creator: Anne Davis

item.title: Protests surrounded the RNC, though in lower numbers than expected
item.description: A big protest marked the beginning of the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee. But by the end of the week, the mood had changed to focus on the RNC's effect on the local community.
item.content:encoded: A big protest marked the beginning of the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee. But by the end of the week, the mood had changed to focus on the RNC's effect on the local community.
item.dc:creator: Liz Baker

item.title: Pushback against over-tourism in Spain is reflected in new signs across Madrid
item.description: Tourism is important to the Spanish economy but critics are arguing the country is too reliant on it.
item.content:encoded: Tourism is important to the Spanish economy but critics are arguing the country is too reliant on it.

item.title: A Communist Party meeting in China aimed to chart a new course for the country
item.description: China’s ruling Communist Party has held an important meeting in Beijing to plan China’s development and reform for the next five years.
item.content:encoded: China’s ruling Communist Party has held an important meeting in Beijing to plan China’s development and reform for the next five years.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: The conservative think tank behind the controversial Project 2025 faces Trump's ire
item.description: The Heritage Foundation and the Trump campaign are attempting to soothe concerns over the think tank's sweeping Project 2025 plan to overhaul the government.
item.content:encoded: The Heritage Foundation and the Trump campaign are attempting to soothe concerns over the think tank's sweeping Project 2025 plan to overhaul the government.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Remembering pioneering Olympic athlete DeHart Hubbard
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon speaks to Maahra Hill, whose great-grandfather, DeHart Hubbard, was the first Black American to win an individual gold medal at the Olympics a century ago.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon speaks to Maahra Hill, whose great-grandfather, DeHart Hubbard, was the first Black American to win an individual gold medal at the Olympics a century ago.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon
